column4: Hello, I am new to Ubuntu, and I have not tried to install yet, but I am thinking of formatting my vista based PC (Laptop) for Ubuntu, I was wondering if there was a list of laptops that would have supported drivers built in to ubuntu?
Which one is ubuntu live? The one that boots from the disk drive?
Can you give me a link? I only see 9.04 and server edition
Or is there a version I can boot off a 8GB flash drive?
i believe there is a list on the Ubuntu.com site of compatible laptops as well for reference
Do you know where the link is, I tried looking but maybe im not so savy?
one sec, i will see if i can find it
I thank you very much. =]
i am currently using and HP Pavillion zd800 and it works great
Madh2, Let me look I will find out in a minute.
i believe it will find the drivers needed just fine
and work without problems*

Is there something built into Ubuntu to find them on the internet automatically? Or do the come with it? Either way I can find them myself, I did it when I had XP on it. xD ALSO, I was always curious, does Ubuntu run .exe's? Like can I install some of my games like tron and stuff?
if finds them automaticaly, and you can get a program called wine to run any .exe programs
without WINE or other such program, .exe will be useless
do not need photoshop, GIMP is freeware version and almost exactly the same
all in all, i suggest Ubuntu as you can find most programs you need for free and with ease(especially using ubuntu site)
wine creates a false c:\ drive to run windows extensions through such as .exe
Alright. I am going to install it. I will def be back soon.
you can install a partition for Ubuntu
it is an option given when talling
yes, it allows you to choose that as an option
i only recently installed Ubuntu on my laptop and am loving it
